net.casper.data.model

Class CDataRowSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.casper.data.model.CDataRowSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class CDataRowSet
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A CDataRowSet represents one or more rows of data, stored in list format. Typically, a query would retrieve all necessary data from the underlying data store (cache or primary), and populate this object to hold the subset of information retrieved from the data store.

    WARNING :: this class is *NOT* thread-safe. You should not share a rowset between multiple threads, this is meant to be used in the context of a single thread / single interaction. The CDataCacheContainer is multi-threaded, and therefore acceptable for persistent storage.

    1. Provides scrolling functionality (akin to java.sql.Resultset) 2. Implements datatype conversions by column (akin to java.sql.Resultset) 3. Sorting is possible on rows in set 4. Simple aggregation can be performed on columns in the rowset. (sum, average, weighted average) (Note that for aggregation, the column's type must be a number)

    Note that the index of the "cursor" begins at 1, whereas the internal storage of the row in the list begins at 0. This is an internal detail, if you intend to modify this class.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    $Revision: 111 $
    Author:
    Jonathan Liang
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • addData

        public void addData(CDataRow[] rows)
             throws CDataGridException
        Adds rows to the row set. If the rows do not match an exception will be thrown. This operation attempts to be "transactional", meaning, if one of the rows fail to qualify, none of the rows are added to the rowset
        Parameters:
        rows - - array of rows to add to rowset
        Throws:
        CDataGridException

      • getMetaDefinition

        public CRowMetaData getMetaDefinition()
        Returns meta-data definition for this row/data set
        Returns:
        CRowMetaData - the meta data definition for this rowset

      • sortByColumn

        public void sortByColumn(String[] columnNames,
                boolean ascending)
                  throws CDataGridException
        Sorts the collection by the specified column name, (if exists) Flag indicates the order in which the collection should be returned. Note: this should not be called unless the cursor has been reset. Call: reset() prior to sort. Otherwise, the scrolling order of the entire rowset will be corrupted.
        Parameters:
        columnName - - column name to sort by
        ascending - - true, if in ascending order
        Throws:
        CDataGridException
